reviewText: Dave Mason sounds as good today as he did 30 years ago.  This latest live concert "Live At Sunrise" shows that this legendary rock guitarist has not lost a step in his ability to play or sing.  The DVD quality is crystal clear with superior digital surround sound.  It's is such a pleasure to actually watch a musician with talent who can actually play as compared to these modern day computerized lip-synchronized pop phenoms who can't sing a note let alone play?  Dave and his band turn in some fine performances such as "Only You Know And I Know", "We Just Disagree, the Traffic classics, "Dear Mr. Fantasy", and "Feelin' Alright" and a blistering version of "All Along The Watchtower" which has become a standard at a Dave Mason concert.  He continues to sing as if he were still 25 years old and this concert is as good if not better then his classic 1976 "Certified live" album.  A bonus live behind the scenes interview is very interesting as mason is seen giving pointers to his band members backstage.  He also makes it clear that he would like to reunite with old Traffic mates Steve Winwood and Jim Capaldi just once more.  My only complaint is the concert could have been a tad longer[only nine songs] clocking in at 66 minutes.  Still this is all quality and if your a fan of classic rock music, it does not get any better than this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Non inspired - He seemed to be out of gas, or just hung over from the previous gig. Dave Mason is one of my all time favorite guitaists and song writers, so I am still looking for a DVD with him in his prime.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Veteran rock singer/guitarist Dave Mason gives a concert at the Sunrise Musical Theater in Ft. Lauderdale, Fla. I don't know exactly when this concert took place. It doesn't say on the DVD but it had to be close to when the DVD was released in 2002.As with other guys from the 1960s, this  "old-timer" can still play and rock with the best of them!This is excellent rock 'n roll.....the best songs that he and his former group "Traffic" put out many years ago. Dave still makes them sound terrific.
summary: Mason Still Makes Rock Classics Sound Good
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed the "green room" chat with the players before the show starts. Dave's "people' just got him a pick up band and went out and did a splendid job. The crowd began to irritate him because they kept wanting to know when there would be a Traffic reunion. He was clearly available but Steve Winwood's ego would never allow them to play on a stage together again (he never forgave Mason for recording "Alone Together" LP, by the way, buy the CD fabulous) and wouldn't allow Dave back in the group. Kind of funny though, he did the Blind Faith thing and returned to Traffic???Buy this DVD, Dave covers the songs you are wanting to hear and age hasn't hurt his voice or his guitar playing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the concert I missed when Dave was here in FL. !!! I was heartbroken cause I really wanted to go but , I had to work !  Now , I can see it all the time and have to admit , I do ! This is very well put together and the selections are Dave's best stuff ; including All Along The Watchtower ! Chicks dig Dave Mason so ,  get yourself this DVD and curl up with your honey !  She'll love you for it !

reviewText: This quote best describes how Dave is commonly known. Dave is one of legendery contributors to R&R.  For fans, this DVD is a perfect example that musicianship is ageless.  For newbies, this DVD can certainly educate and highlight what making music was once all about.  Regardless of the DVD production, this performance brings us closer to an unsung hero.  Furthermore, have you ever seen a tighter frigging band!!!!!!!
summary: "That's the guy that does that song!! "
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been a Dave Mason fan since the 70s. I'm amazed he has not lost a thing he just get's better. I can't believe some of the petty complaints written here from other reviewers. Yes, I wish it were longer but that would not stop me from buying it. I thought the band was tight as hell. Dave still has a great voice and man he can still play. The song selection was excellent, I also have (Live At Perkins Palace) in my opinion I think that one is not as good. This (Live At Sunrise) is way better, also the DTS is very clean the picture quality is also excellent, well done Dave thank you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: $20 (a month) + Netflix = opportunities to audition numerous concert DVD's.  Some are better than others but occasionally you come across a real gem.  Such is Live at Sunrise.  Sound and video are excellent and the camera work is some of the best.  You actually get to focus on the camera shots.  This is how a show should be recorded - lots of stage shots and close ups of Dave's very talented playing (as well as the other members).  If you like Dave's music, Traffic in their prime and you're a baby boomer like me then you'll probably like this one.Oh yeah, 4 stars???? Well it's in full screen.  Anamorphic would have rated 5 starts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm an old Dave Mason fan from when I was in highschool. He does a great job here covering some of his hits.  He still has his voice and his band are all great musicians.
